item.description: Inside your head is a thing called the subconscious that's primitive, has little understanding of the world. It mainly sees you, and projects all its memories on you. It's looking out through your eyes the same way you view the cosmos. WIth awe but little actual understanding.

It's looking out through your eyes the same way you view the cosmos. WIth awe but little actual understanding.

item.description:
Some people just wanna argue.

You can assume I'm wrong if it makes you feel good.

I honestly don't give a fuck.

Have a nice day. 😀

item.description:
1/4 People think so linear about the #Knicks. There are quite a few players out there with the potential of Donovan Mitchell to lead a team to dynasty.

2/4 Think of what the Knicks have to offer a potential trader. The Knicks bench is filled with potential like few others are. We've got a stockpile of draft picks. And the Knicks and the Garden and the talent are starting to get interesting to players. Like the way they want to

3/4 go to Duke or Kentucky. The Knicks are the un-Nets. The Knicks are building, not trying to buy a post-season powerhouse. 😀

4/4 So sit tight, this is not the end of the dream of what those kids on the bench could become. They can become lots of things, not just Donovan Mitchell.
item.source:markdown:
1/4 People think so linear about the #Knicks. There are quite a few players out there with the potential of Donovan Mitchell to lead a team to dynasty.
2/4 Think of what the Knicks have to offer a potential trader. The Knicks bench is filled with potential like few others are. We've got a stockpile of draft picks. And the Knicks and the Garden and the talent are starting to get interesting to players. Like the way they want to
3/4 go to Duke or Kentucky. The Knicks are the un-Nets. The Knicks are building, not trying to buy a post-season powerhouse. 😀
4/4 So sit tight, this is not the end of the dream of what those kids on the bench could become. They can become lots of things, not just Donovan Mitchell.

item.description:
@JoeTrippi You could say the same thing of the Democratic president. It really is all our responsibility to protect democracy. This is the problem everywhere in our country, the world. People are only aware of their own interest, not our shared interest.

@JoeTrippi You see it in tech when investors want to reap the reward of other people's work on open systems, and never want to make any contributions of their own.

@JoeTrippi BTW, I think the journalists are mostly on board with the idea that journalism has to fight on the side of freedom. It's the owners that are forcing them to change back.
